Name: Amulet of Isis, Horus & Nephthys
Description: Schematically cut image of the goddesses Isis and Nephthys, each shown as a striding woman, wearing on her head the hieroglyphic writing of her name: between the two goddesses is the child of Isis, the god Horus, shown in human form. Such figures are common in the large sets of amulets placed on the mummified body in Late Period burials.
